intro: Acrostichum gaboonense, commonly known as Gaboon fern, is a species of fern native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its leathery, compound fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The fronds are also sometimes harvested for ornamental purposes due to their attractive appearance.
